result.execSummary:
The defendant Randy J Gomez Garcia was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC [Modifiers: as a Party to a Crime], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
--to pay costs of $243 plus the $200 DNA surcharge
 plus $50 drug testing fee

--to undergo AODA assessment and follow through with recommended treatment  per Agent
--to undergo any other assessment, treatment or counseling as deemed appropriate by the Agent
--random drug and/or alcohol screening
--absolute sobriety (no alcohol, no controlled substances, take all prescription drugs as prescribed)
--to obtain/maintain employment and/or education program as approved by the Agent
--No contact with any known drug offender, except for treatment purposes as deemed appropriate per Agent

The Court grants Mr. Gomez Garcia expungement upon successful completion of Probation.

Arresting Agency: WTPD

  If probation, parole or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of the victim(s) and government entities for the balance due.

Cases 15CM223 and 15CM235 called together at 8:17am [mo]
Defendant Randy J Gomez Garcia in court with Attorney Erik I. Colque.   ADA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.

Maximum penalties recited; Constitutional rights reviewed; plea of " Guilty " entered on Count #1 of Case 15CM235 and plea of "No Contest" entered on Count #3 of Case 15CM223; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; the Court accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses: all remaining counts of both cases

Sentencing arguments given by Counsel

On Count #1 of Case 15CM235 and Count #3 of Case 15CM223, the Court withholds sentence, and places Defendant on Probation for 2 years, with conditions:

--to undergo AODA assessment and follow through with recommended treatment
 per Agent
--to undergo any other assessment, treatment or counseling as deemed appropriate by the Agent
--random drug and/or alcohol screening
--absolute sobriety (no alcohol, no controlled substances, take all prescription drugs as prescribed)
--to obtain/maintain employment and/or education program as approved by the Agent
--No contact with any known drug offender, except for treatment purposes as deemed appropriate per Agent
--On Count #1 of Case 15CM235: to pay costs of $243 plus the $200 DNA surcharge
 plus $50 drug testing fee
--On Count #3 of Case 15CM223: to pay costs of $243 plus the $200 DNA surcharge plus $50 drug testing fee

On Case 15CM235: The Court suspends Mr. Gomez Garcia's drivers license for 6 months

The Court finds that society will not be harmed and will benefit from Mr. Gomez Garcia's expungement.

The Court grants Mr. Gomez Garcia expungement upon successful completion of Probation.

As to Each Case: Days credit for time already served:  0 days
recess: 8:47am

Cases 15CM235 and 15CM223 called together at 9:48am [mo]
Defendant Randy J Gomez Garcia in court with Attorney Erik I. Colque.   ADA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.
ADA Monica Hall verifies victim rights compliance

Atty. Colque requests a Plea and Sentencing date prior to 11/4/2015
The Court and Counsel discuss scheduling.
recess:9:51am


NEXT: For Both Cases: Plea/Sentencing on 10/26/15 at 8:10am
Criminal complaint Amended by the Courts own hand//correcting the middle initial

Cases 15CM223 and 15CM235 called at 1:57pm [mo]
Defendant Randy Y Gomez Garcia in court with Attorney Erik I. Colque.   ADA Brookellen Teuber appears for the State of Wisconsin.

The Court verifies date of birth and address on Criminal Complaint
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charge and maximum penalties are recited.
The Court finds probable cause to exist in the Criminal Complaint. 
Pleas of "not guilty" entered; speedy trial waived by the Defendant

The Court requires $1000  signature bond to cover both files, with conditions: 
--to maintain absolute sobriety
--no possession or consumption of controlled substances without valid prescription
--take all current prescriptions as prescribed by Physician
--not to drive without current Driver's License 

ADA Teuber orally motion to change Mr. Gomez Garcia's middle initital to 'J' in both cases
--no objection from the Defense

The Court orders that Mr. Gomez Garcia's middle initial be changed to 'J'
recess: 2:06pm


NEXT:  (1) Provide the Court with Copy of Criminal Complaint so that it can amend the middle initial (2) Pretrial Conference on 8/26/15 at 11:20am   (3)  Status Conference on 9/29/15 at 9:30am
